title: Unmasking tuberculosis triggered IgA nephropathy.
abstract: Tuberculosis-triggered IgA nephropathy (TB-IgAN) is a rare but important renal manifestation that often goes unrecognised due to its non-specific presentation. We report the case of a woman in her 30s who presented with progressive oedema, decreased urine output, frothy urine, intermittent dark-coloured urine and a short history of productive cough.
